channel.title: [317][PI] - Ipbanned myself, Please Help!
channel.description:
Hey guys,
I was currently testing out the command ::ipban, but i had no one to test it on so i used it on myself thinking that i would be able to just delete my ip from the "Ipsbanned" list, but when i deleted my IP from the list: i still cant log in.
Can someone please help me out because i am the owner of the server and cant even log into it from my IP.
(I can't use the "::unipban" because i can't log in to use it!)

item.title: [317][PI] - Ipbanned myself, Please Help!
item.dc:creator: @BrandonRSPS BrandonRSPS
item.description:
@BrandonRSPS wrote:

Search for your external IP or 127.0.0.1 in your server files, should be in a .txt file, I could be wrong, just an educated guess.

Read full topic

item.title: [317][PI] - Ipbanned myself, Please Help!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Restart your server. Lol.
PI’s have a temporary list that’s built when the server is started, reading the data from ipsbanned.txt. The list is modified when you do the commands respectively, along with the file.
Removing your name from the .txt doesn’t change the list that’s in the server unless you did the ::unip command.
So yeah, just restart your server after removing your own IP.

Read full topic
